channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping here every week, 17th February
item.description:
At least once a week rubbish is dumped at the end of the street. It can vary from scrap to cat litter to food waste.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London

item.title: Fly-Tipping:, 17th February
item.description:
All this rubbish has been there for over a month. It’s steadily increasing, and the entire area is now littered with waste. The street is in urgent need of a proper clean as well.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Listria Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 34 York Way, 17th February
item.description:
Hi, I am working of behalf of my client to deliver the Highway Works which are part of the S106 planning obligations for Islington Council Planning App. No. P2023/0381/S73. The required Highway Works are for the widening of a 12m length of the existing loading bay outside Jahn Court, 34 York Way, London, N1 9AB. Google Streetview: https://maps.app.goo.gl/BMkkZa5RHtkhEk4m7 The proposed levels of the widened loading bay are to match the existing footway levels. However, I have identified from the GPR utility survey that your apparatus is likely to affected by the construction of the proposed flush granite edge kerb, due to the shallow depth of your apparatus in the footway at this location. I am therefore proposing a diversion of your apparatus as shown on attached drawing 9025-JCL-RGP-XX-XX-DR-C-0102. • Could you please confirm if our Contractor can undertake these proposed works to your apparatus, and your construction requirements? • Else, can you please provide a C3 budget estimate for the proposed diversion works shown? Please let me know if you need any additional information or if you have any questions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, York Way, Barnsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes, 17th February
item.description:
There is a big pothole in the road by the pedestrian crossing. To be honest there are SO many potholes along Burnt Ash Lane from Southover up to Plaistow and College Road. This whole stretch of road is scattered with potholes that are getting bigger, deeper and worse each day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed up abandoned car, 17th February
item.description:
